Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Hemispherical bowl with a simple lip, made from a rather crude clay. This vessel is of the black and red ware type.  The exterior surface bears traces of a heavy polish that enhances the rippled effect of numerous A-Group ceramics (hence "rippled ware").The lip is decorated with fine diagonal incisions.
